favourite.article: Charles Wesley wrote this hymn in 1749 under the title of "The Whole Armor of God", and it was used to confirm new converts. The early Methodists took their lives in their hands when they announced themselves as followers of John and Charles Wesley. One writer declared, "There were outrageously treated - stoned, mauled, ducked, hounded with bulldogs, threatened, homes looted, businesses ruined. Anyone who walked through a town could pick out by their ruinous condition the houses where Methodists lived." In one incident at Devizes in Feb, 1747, a crowd surrounded the house where the Methodist leaders were staying, breaking the windows and ripping off the shutters. - Great Songs of Faith by Brown & Norton

I praise God for the full armor in Ephesians 6:10-20. By utilizing the sword of the Spirit we can take the offensive against the forces of darkness in the world, the flesh and the devil and overcome evil with good. Speak the truth in love and be a winner through scriptural songs.
